page.title: 05Beef farming in Evie
page.content: Beef is the main farming enterprise. The stock is mostly cross-cows bred with Charolais or Simmental bulls. Some Hereford and Aberdeen Angus bulls are also used. Steadings tend to be larger in proportion to acreage when compared to the Scottish mainland. This is due to the long winter keep from November until May. Tied byres are becoming less common and most of the cattle sheds being built are cubicles or slats. Sloped floor byres are particularily suited to Orkney which has limited straw for bedding. Most farms have their cows calving in the spring. Calves are suckled over the summer and weaned when the cattle come in. They are then fed until 18 months to 2 years when they are sold for beef at the Kirkwall Mart, Stromness Mart or abattoir in Kirkwall
